Reviews.Title: “Good location for downtown Los Angeles/Hollywood.”
Reviews.Author: mixer-driver
Reviews.Content: Quiet,comfortable queen bed, working neighbourhood, we walked 3 blocks to 2 fast food places, did not get 6am wake up call, staff helpful, would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent for the price”
Reviews.Author: Heinrich121
Reviews.Content: Fast Check In, Central Location ( Red Line is two blocks), clean, quite. The Hotel is okay for the money you pay. Towels and linen were changed every day. We even got fresh soap each day! No problems with noise or something else. It's safe! There are some hispanic shops around, be nice and you get nice service ;) (and save a lot of money) If you prefer 7-Eleven it's two blocks, like Mc Donalds, Tacos and other cheap fast food. We stayed there for three nights came home late, early, whatever..there where no problems with the reception (24/7) or the area. If you like to save money and you are not too picky (yes the carpets are old and yes even the bathtub is not from 2011) but it's okay for a couple of nights and it's convenient if you travel with a car into this huge city of L.A.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for money”
Reviews.Author: jas1313
Reviews.Content: Hotel is at a great location and is value for money. There are several restaurants close by with convenience shops and public transport available. On site parking is available for free and the hotel has well serviced rooms with good amenities including cable tv and wifi internet. Good, clean and comfortable motel/hotel if on a budget and would prefer to spend your money of site seeing rather than expensive accommodations while in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Pinkmartini88
Reviews.Content: Was looking for a good affordable place to stay during our trip in LA. About 20 minutes drive to the town area. The neighbourhood is rather quiet at night, not really safe to walk around but we drove, so not that bad. The staff were OK. The room was clean, fully air-conditioned. Most importantly, the toilets are clean. Everything in the room was fine. Initially, the impression I had for Inns were rather run down, but America's Value Inn at North Alvarado Street turns out to be a different perspective. Walked down the street along the main road about 5 minutes, you can find lots of Mexican food, Subway, Starbucks. Most importantly, for a place like this, the prices are really affordable if you are on a budget trip to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Rude!”
Reviews.Author: lttg
Reviews.Content: I wanted to put a room on hold for some family members, so I called them. The woman said they still have a room and that she'd put it on hold. She asked for my last name and than hung up the phone pretty quick. 2 hours later my family arrived there and all rooms where gone. So I called again. The woman who picked up the phone told me they gave it away after an hour (understandable, would have liked a warning though) and that she would have needed a credit card number. She definetly did NOT give me THAT information. When I complained that I got kind of missinformed by her she said by and hung up on me.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, Good room, Affordable, Great location”
Reviews.Author: satchel82
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel to avoid the drive home (approx 40 miles away) after a concert and night on the town. The hotel staff was very accomodating and welcoming and the room was actually better than expected. We were able to walk to the Staples center and LA Live and then around downtown as well. If you need a place to stay in downtown and want a clean room that's affordable I would highly recommend this hotel. We felt so comfortable we've decided to stay at this hotel everytime we plan a night out in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Bad vibes. Where to begin?”
Reviews.Author: SebS26
Reviews.Content: The story of our stay: 1. We find the place online. $62? Great. And it looks like it's right by Silverlake and the freeway. Perfect. 2. We arrive. Turns out it's not quite in Silverlake. A little closer to Shadesville. Coming inside, we're greeted by the lovely and inviting Plexiglas window to protect the desk clerk. Good for him. Where's ours? 3. We begin to sense a vague creepiness that we just can't pinpoint. I'm not normally picky about hotels. When I'm on vacation I come to the hotel to sleep and shower; all I ask is that it be quiet and clean. And it seemed to be ok. The room looked fine at first - decent size, clean-ish bathroom, functioning internet, normal motel amenities. But something just felt "off" here. 4. We notice that there is something alive in the wall. Some kind of insect or rodent noise coming from *inside* the wall between the main room and the bathroom. It didn't sound like a cricket or cicada but it wasn't a pipe or heater noise either. My girlfriend begins to freak out. 5. The brown thing. We find an approx. 1 inch roundish clump of a brown unidentified substance on the floor next to the bed. It looks somewhere between a dessicated poo and a clump of coffee grounds. There is no coffee maker in the room. I can't prove that it was poo, but it sure wasn't pleasant. 6. We decide we're leaving. It's 11:30 the same night we arrived and we abandon ship for a normal motel in actual Silverlake. This is the first time in my life I've ever done this. As if to confirm we made the right choice, we notice a sign in the stairwell stating that "products used or sold on these premises contain chemicals known to the state of California to cause cancer." I don't know if this is a common thing, but it was the first time I'd noticed that sign anywhere. 7. On a positive note, the night clerk was very pleasant when we checked out. 8. My girlfriend's cell phone - in her purse - mysteriously called mine as we were driving away. I wonder what Ghost Hunters would turn up at this place. Not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: traveller03Toronto
Reviews.Content: We got to the inn at 9 am when check-in was at 3 pm. The hotel staff was extremely friendly. Although we couldn't check in early (b/c the room was still occupied), the receptionist offered to keep our bags meanwhile so we could go travel. They were extremely nice and always offered to help us meet our needs. The room itself was pretty decent. Comfortable and clean bed. The only drawback was a nasty sewage smell that greated us when we opened the door. However, we turned on the air conditioning and the smell was pretty much gone in 2 hours. The room was pretty quiet. Internet was free and stable. There were numerous television channels. Overall, a very positive experience. Especially considering such good value for the near downtown location.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel for the price, very good location”
Reviews.Author: Dudeneverstop
Reviews.Content: Pros: Good staff and very good location, near downtown (3 min) and Hollywood (2 min). Rooms have fridge, desk, free WIFI and free parking. Cons: little room, would need a renovation, noisy road near. Just ok for the night, but don't spend much time here, better go outside. no pool.

Reviews.Title: “Very cool place / Awesome staff”
Reviews.Author: Virginie_7791
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 2 weeks and a half on august 2k8 :) i choosed this hotel because of the proximity of downtown. Bus stop at 1meter bus #200 to the metro station around 20min to get there - 200 meters or so to the bus # 704 to santa monica (1h30 to santa monica drive thru beverly hills its cool to see all that places from the bus and meet ppl. The staff is awesome!!! Very helpful, smart... smile a lot, always here to hear or reply to ur question, find solution or help for ur day trip :). actually I miss Carmen & the second floor's housekeeper Erica :) but all the staff is cool :) the room are big sizes, very clean, the housekeeper always make sure u miss nothing at ur room... if the hotel isnt full they'll show u differents room and let u choose. Wireless work perfectly, the fridge & the microhoover are there no worries lol the tv works well too lol at 200 meters from the hotel, starbucks, shops for food, lavatory... 2 types of buses. if I have (and im sure I will) to come back to LA u can be sure Iâ€™ll go thereâ€¦ you really feel like homeâ€¦ and that was important to me! A bit noisy at nite, but hey? If u want a calm placeâ€¦ go to UTAH lol (or stay home ;)) this place was cool cause i felt for something like 3 weeks americans :) if i had a car there...i would had the' cahnce to see all the things i saw, met the ppl i met...

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the price”
Reviews.Author: Bob_in_Minneapolis
Reviews.Content: We were in L.A. for a conference near Echo Park, and this motel was recommended. We were very happy with it. It doesn't pretend to be a four-star place, but it's clean, comfortable, and inexpensive. The bed was great, the shower (no tub) was clean, there was a mini-fridge in the room. Some street noise from Alvarado, but not awful. Security seemed good. Convenient to 101 freeway & Sunset Blvd., close to downtown. On the down side--rooms are fairly small (though not terribly so); no iron or ironing board (though they might provide if needed); no coffee-maker. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Safe!”
Reviews.Author: tamitrue
Reviews.Content: Was worried about the area...not the greatest but it was perfectly safe (two girls staying!) Close to practically everything in Hollywood...and was a nice starting point to a bunch of other locations. Would definately stay again. The Hotel was clean and nice enough...small rooms. Management was polite and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Americas Best Value inn for 3 nights. It lies on Sunset Boulevard, which can be a very busy road. The hotel was very noisy due to the noise from the street, I couldn't sleep very well. But besides that the hotel is decent. The rooms are not very large, but they are clean. The bathroom was very clean as well. The television worked fine. Everyday, two new free bottles of water were put on my desk by the cleaning ladies, which was a nice welcome present for hot LA. However do bring your own shampoo, it is not provided by the hotel as I expected. The cleaners don't speak English, but the people behind the desk do and are very friendly. There is no internet in this hotel, but they when you ask they will refer you to the nearby Motel 8 hotel, where you can use internet at $1 per 10 minutes, which I found pretty expensive. However if you have a laptop with you, you might want to try and find a wireless network. In the morning you can take a free breakfast, which consists of not too good coffee and a biscuit. This is nice to overcome the time to go out and find a good breakfast place in the neighbourhood (which I never really found). There is a restaurant next to the hotel, it is maybe even part of the hotel, that wasn't very clear. However, I entered this place once, and never went back, it didn't look very clean. There is a bus stop nearby the hotel and this was very convenient, bus n2 runs to beverly hills. Hollywood and the walk of fame are only 10 minutes walk away from the hotel. The metro station Hollywood/western is 5 minutes walking from the hotel. The neighbourhood didn't look very safe at first sight, it is a more poverish part of sunset boulevard. I was travelling alone and I am a 26y woman, but I never had any problems and never felt unsafe, but I never came back to my hotel later than 9pm, so I can't really tell how it would be later in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: TnTravel-CEO
Reviews.Content: I traveled to LA for a business trip in June. I stayed at this Americas Best Value Inn for 4 nights. The room was clean and the staff was courteous. There were no frills - no tub, only a shower; had to get the TV remote from the front desk; there was no High Speed Internet Access. The parking lot was well lit and I felt safe at this hotel. The management was very helpful - recommending restaurants, driving tours, etc. I recommend this hotel for a value minded traveler. I would stay there again.

HotelInfo.Name: Americas Best Value Inn - Los Angeles / Hollywood
HotelInfo.Address: 811 North Alvarado St, Los Angeles, CA 90026
